items.title: Process Urgent Patients Instantly
items.statement: When a trauma or critical patient arrives at the ER, I want to complete intake registration in under 30 seconds, so I can prevent dangerous delays during life-threatening situations.

items.title: Work Effectively with Gloves
items.statement: When processing patients while wearing gloves or with sanitized hands, I want to interact with the UI without removing gloves, so I can maintain infection control protocols and avoid workflow disruptions.

items.title: Use Keyboard Navigation Exclusively
items.statement: When entering patient data during high-volume periods, I want to use tab-enter navigation exclusively, so I can process patients without touching the mouse and maximize speed.

items.title: Escalate Trauma Cases Immediately
items.statement: When a trauma patient arrives requiring immediate doctor attention, I want to bypass normal intake workflow with one click, so I can get the patient to clinical staff instantly without data entry delays.

items.title: Mark Patients Who Leave Without Being Seen
items.statement: When a patient leaves the waiting room before being triaged, I want to mark them as 'LWBS' (Left Without Being Seen) in one click, so I can prevent backlog confusion and maintain accurate queue status.

items.title: Work Comfortably During Night Shifts
items.statement: When working night shifts in a dimly lit ER, I want to use a dark mode interface, so I can reduce eye strain and avoid screen brightness discomfort during 12-hour shifts.

items.title: Identify Next Patient Instantly
items.statement: When I complete triage for one patient, I want to see the next patient in queue immediately without searching, so I can prevent bottlenecks and maintain efficient patient flow.

items.title: Capture Vitals Quickly with Gloves
items.statement: When taking patient vitals while wearing gloves, I want to enter BP, HR, O2, and Temp values with large touch targets, so I can maintain infection control without slowing workflow.

items.title: Assign Initial ESI Level
items.statement: When completing triage assessment, I want to assign an ESI (Emergency Severity Index) level using large, color-coded buttons, so I can quickly communicate patient acuity to the doctor.

items.title: Add Clinical Context for Doctor
items.statement: When I observe concerning patient behavior or clinical indicators, I want to add free-text contextual notes, so the doctor has qualitative information beyond vitals and ESI scores.

items.title: Onboard Float Staff Without Training
items.statement: When regular staff are on vacation and float nurses arrive, I want them to use the system effectively within 30 seconds, so we don't experience workflow disruption or errors due to unfamiliarity.

items.title: Work Comfortably During Night Shifts
items.statement: When working night shifts in a dimly lit triage room, I want to use a dark mode interface, so I can reduce eye strain and avoid burning eyes after 12-hour shifts.

items.title: Maintain Full Manual Control Over Prioritization
items.statement: When evaluating triaged patients, I want to manually assign wait time slots based on clinical judgment, so I can prevent automated systems from overriding critical medical decisions.

items.title: Visualize Patient Flow via Kanban Board
items.statement: When managing patient flow throughout my shift, I want to see all patients organized in time-based columns, so I can prioritize evaluations and drag-and-drop patients as conditions change.

items.title: See Real-Time Wait Time Alerts
items.statement: When patients approach or exceed their assigned wait time thresholds, I want to receive visual alerts, so I can re-evaluate prioritization before conditions escalate.

items.title: Update Public Display Instantly
items.statement: When I assign or update a patient's wait time slot, I want the change to appear on the public waiting room display within 1 second, so patients don't confront staff due to perceived lag.

items.title: Bulk Update Patients When Beds Open
items.statement: When trauma beds become available, I want to select multiple 'Immediate' patients and move them to 'With Doctor' status at once, so I can efficiently manage patient flow during bed turnover.

items.title: Flag Patients for Security
items.statement: When I identify a patient exhibiting aggressive or unpredictable behavior, I want to flag them for security coordination, so staff are aware of potential safety risks without displaying this on the public board.

items.title: Work on Desktop and Tablet Seamlessly
items.statement: When moving between command center (desktop) and mobile triage (tablet), I want the same workflow and UI, so I don't have to learn device-specific interactions.

items.title: Ensure Patients Recognize Their ID
items.statement: When patients wait for triage or treatment, I want them to recognize their identifier on the public display, so they feel acknowledged and human rather than just a number.

items.title: Reduce Patient Anxiety with Safe Wait Time Communication
items.statement: When displaying wait times to patients, I want to use category-based messaging (e.g., '30-minute wait') instead of countdown timers, so patients don't become confrontational when times expire.

items.title: Maintain Privacy Compliance on Public Display
items.statement: When displaying patient status information, I want to ensure no GDPR or HIPAA violations occur, so the hospital avoids legal liability and protects patient privacy.

items.title: Create Calming Visual Environment
items.statement: When patients and families wait in the ER during night hours, I want the public display to use dark mode, so we reduce sensory overload in an already stressful environment.

items.title: Enable Family Tracking of Patient Progress
items.statement: When family members wait in the lobby, I want them to track their loved one's progress via the patient ID, so they feel informed and reassured without violating privacy.

items.title: Ensure System Works During Internet Outages
items.statement: When internet connectivity is lost during storms or outages, I want the system to continue operating on the internal LAN, so we don't lose patient queue data or disrupt clinical workflow.

items.title: Deploy Updates Manually Without Vendor VPN
items.statement: When a new system release is ready, I want to deploy it manually via tarball delivery, so I don't need to wait 2 weeks for vendor VPN approval.

items.title: Enforce GDPR/HIPAA Compliance
items.statement: When auditing system compliance, I want to verify patient data privacy controls, so we avoid legal liability and regulatory violations.

items.title: Manage LDAP Authentication and Role-Based Access
items.statement: When onboarding new staff or assigning system access, I want to integrate with Active Directory for authentication and enforce role-based access control, so clinical staff have write access and public displays have view-only access.

items.title: Mitigate Session Timeout Data Loss
items.statement: When staff are interrupted during data entry and the 15-minute session timeout occurs, I want partially completed forms to be autosaved, so staff don't lose work and have to re-enter data.
